website_summaries.verdict: Get professional-level results without breaking the bank.
pros: High sides are handy for making sauces without a mess
Features a polished, nonstick cooking surface that won't react with various types of food
cons: Material gets very hot during the cooking process

website_summaries.verdict: A well-made stainless steel model that can't be beat by its competitors for design, construction, and performance.
pros: Separates itself from the rest of the pack in terms of overall construction quality and durability
Exceptional design that is both extremely practical and aesthetically pleasing
cons: It's a costly model, but the price is what you'd expect for such high quality

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edges cut finger
customer_reviews.text: The top edge on this pot was so sharp it cut my husband's hand when washing the first time. Dangerous
customer_reviews.author: FRIEDA COONEY

customer_reviews.title: Discoloration after first use
customer_reviews.text: Discoloration after first use. I followed all the instructions that came in the manual and also kept the pan at low heat throughout the cooking process and found grey blue coloration at the base of the pan from the inside. I don't know if it's safe to use this pan any more.
customer_reviews.author: Poonam

customer_reviews.title: Nervous but do not regret
customer_reviews.text: I need to replace my old pots and decided to go all out and buy the best, I did a lot of research and asked friends, who all recommended All Clad. I got my pots about a month ago so unable to rate durability at the moment even though I was nervous there was no big adjustment in cooking other then items are cooking quicker due to the heat distribution, only draw back no clear lids on the pots I ordered which I like to use to keep an eye on veggies etc Overall very pleased and will be replacing other pots with these in the future
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Good for Sunday dinner AND Tuesday Mac-N-Cheese
customer_reviews.text: As with everything All-Clad, this is a very well constructed pot. Shockingly, in addition to the expected soups and sauces, this is quite good at making 2 boxes of mac-and-cheese. I expected that to be far too sticky for efficient cleanup and cooking, but I can clean this very quickly. Pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Haon the GreatTop Contributor: Chess

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed I am a professional food person
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed I am a professional food person, and have bought this product for many years. Just got this item delivered, and see that it is vastly inferior to the previous ones I have bought. Thinner gauge metal, no copper accent stripe (looks very nice on my other ones,) and a very rough finish on the inside of the pot. The older ones had a very nice rolled lip that made for a very tight fitting lid. This pan has a very rough cut unfinished lip that looks third rate. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: michael lappert

customer_reviews.title: Shame on you, Amazon!!
customer_reviews.text: This is not real All-Clad. I have the old one that I burned. This one is dramatically lighter and goes straight up. I looked at William Sonoma and they have the REAL deal. Shame on you Amazon! This is a scam.
customer_reviews.author: undertheradar7323

customer_reviews.title: the dimensions listed for the 1.5 quart model are NOT correct
customer_reviews.text: The stated dimensions for the d3 1.5 quart model is listed as 12.38 x 6.13 x 6.25 inches. 6.13 is the diameter of the pot and 6.25 inches is the height. However, the 1.5 qt model i received is only 3.54" tall. That's a far cry from 6.25". Even if you count it with the lid on it's not anywhere near 6.25". Additionally, the "main" photo associated with the 1.5 qt model is the same as the 2 qt model (the one i received did not look like the photo. That's why i had to break out the calipers.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Marshall

customer_reviews.title: A good quality pan
customer_reviews.text: This is quality cookware with a few problems. It heats and cooks evenly. It's handle is sturdy but very uncomfortable. It is basically just a taller version of their 1 1/2 quart sauce pan. It is fairly narrow and I had to search for a steamer that would fit inside it. I have a number of All-Clad pans because of the way they cook and clean. I recommend you try the handle before you buy. Remember, when you remove it from the stove it's going to be heavier due to the food and liquid in the pan.
customer_reviews.author: Morning Edition Listener

customer_reviews.title: This pan isn't designed for pouring after heating
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 1 qt sauce pan to heat my chai, and discovered that it's impossible to pour the liquid into a coffee cup without spilling it all over the countertop. Very disappointing! Please, All-Clad, fix that huge flaw in how the pan is shaped. I've used Cuisinart pans for years, and it's completely easy to pour from those sauce pans. I'd like my money back!
customer_reviews.author: Mary in Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: pot creates a strange taste to food
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's that I usually use another brand and metal, but when I cook with this pot--rice in particular, it creates an odd taste to the food. Heat distribution is also off since things stick to one side of pot and not the other.
customer_reviews.author: James Brashears

customer_reviews.title: Really nice but expected for the price
customer_reviews.text: I guess for most people these are fairly pricey. They are what we expected for the price. Sturdy, well made, great cooking, and they look awesome. We also bought some Tramontina Tri-Ply Clad (Made in Brazil) just to compare and to also save some money. Man those are really close to All-Clad. Maybe not quite up to par with All-Clad but very close and somewhat cheaper to buy. If you don't really need to save the money go with All-Clad you won't be dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shuryje

customer_reviews.title: Great pot well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The All-Clad 4201.5 1.5-Quart Stainless Steel Tri-Ply Bonded Sauce Pan with Lid is simply excellent. This is a sturdy pot made in the USA by Craftsmen that make quality the top priority. The pot heats evenly and its overall performance has be excellent. Clean up has been a breeze and I have only cleaned it by hand. I have only had the pan for a week as of this writing but have been impressed. While the price of All-Clad is high, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Montycs

customer_reviews.title: it gave a great cooking experiencing
customer_reviews.text: I own a 3 qt sauce pan and using it for more than three months. From day one, it gave a great cooking experiencing. It is heavy and strong. Handle is long and comfortable for holding while cooking. Lid fits well, hold the steam inside and controls loss of heat. Best product in my kitchen. On the first day of cooking the color of the inner surface started fading and that’s becos of salt, which is fine for me as long as the color of food is good. Overall, this is one of the best sause pan, I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: kannan

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to add to my purchase of a set of All Clad I bought recently. Heat distribution is a 10!!. It is excellent. If you haven’t had the pleasure to cook with All Clad, you should buy one piece and see what an amazing high-quality piece to add to your kitchen. Use Barkeepers Friend (cleaning powder) to restore that new look. BTW, Barkeepers Friend is a 10 also. Very effective even when very small amounts used.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Al-clad is simply the best. It's the only brand I've cook with for 20 years now.
customer_reviews.text: Won't buy anything except Al-clad. It's the only brand I cook with. Have many of their various pans etc. Some are 20 years old and they look brand new. The perfect cooking tools. Don't even think about buying anything else. I've had the 4 quart for 20 years, but with 3 kids who love to cook and make smaller portions, I thought I'd try getting another 4 quart and also try this 3 quart. We love the 3 quart. The cost savings compared to the world famous 4 quart is remarkable and it works just as well when the portions are slightly smaller and your turning and burning through pans every day. Should have bought one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: C.J. Lang

customer_reviews.title: When heated the pan can spin on a flat surface
customer_reviews.text: Nice little pan, but for the price I didn’t expect it would be a spinner. First cook today on medium heat to heat corn. The pan sits flat when cold but as soon as it heated it became slightly concave and since I have a glass top stove it spun very easily. I have the 1qt saucier which stays flat when heated. Certainly a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor A Wacker

customer_reviews.title: Great price for an excellent pot.
customer_reviews.text: I like All-Clad. IMO, it's superior to almost all other cookware. This is a terrific price for this pot. Just remember you have something on the stove or in the oven when cooking.. Advanced age seems to be affecting my memory. Forgot I was making soup until the smoke alarm went off. Thus, had to purchase this new 3-qt. pot. Oh, well. Guess I need to set timers around the house when anything is on the cooktop or in the oven. Don't get old; your thinker gets thunked!
customer_reviews.author: Slh1940

customer_reviews.title: All-Clad can do no wrong
customer_reviews.text: I'll buy and recommend All-Clad over and over again. Excellent quality for the price point, and so well-designed. I also bought the 3-quart fitting steamer to go with this. It's a great basic size for cooking pasta for two, for reheating soup or making oatmeal for the family. Heat distribution is good and it cleans up fairly easily.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Does not get better than this
customer_reviews.text: Top quality throughout. Solid, heavy, and virtually indestructible. The pot performs as well as I knew/hoped that it would. Fits on the small size burner exactly. Heats fast, and resists overboiling. Cannot say enough good about this piece of kitchen cookware. If I have my way, I will only own All-Clad from here on out. I can see it lasting the rest of my life.
customer_reviews.author: Coghan

customer_reviews.title: pot luck
customer_reviews.text: This is the third All-Clad pot I have bought, over several years. I would recommend this particular pot, and this brand, to any cook, serious or casual. Although it's a good size for steaming veggies, I think of this size as a 'sauce pot', because it is perfect for puddings and sauces -- you can cook faster, as the three-ply bottom tempers and protects your sauce from lumping while you stir, and since your heat can be a bit higher, the cooking is faster. I will be giving a pot like this to my daughter, who is graduating from a top-tier cooking school this summer.
customer_reviews.author: S. Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Great product out of the USA!
customer_reviews.text: I needed new pans for new glasstop stove. This is perfect (glass,ceramic,enameled,copper,iron not recommended). This is perfect! First this is made in USA. Second, the pan has high sides. I heated cream soup in it right away. No scorching or hot spots. Will be ordering more versions! High recommend this brand!
customer_reviews.author: F Clark

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Cookware
customer_reviews.text: This was the 2nd Piece to my collection of All Clad, its a great pot for anything you want to cook. The stainless Steel is very easy to clean. I have the 12 inch Frying Pan with lid, the 8 Quart Pot with lid and this 3 Quart Pot with lid. The only complaint I have is; I wish I had made the investment 30+ years ago. Spend the money, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S.

customer_reviews.title: Pricey
customer_reviews.text: Not sure worth the price although a dream to cook with. It may be the "cache" of cooking with Allclad is worth it for a pricy 3 quart pan. Non the less I plan on a 2 qt pan which might be a more useful size. Worth reading the difference in All Clad models on the internet, some are not dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: Greta

customer_reviews.title: Stunning.
customer_reviews.text: These are gorgeous and functional. They inspire you. They make you want to cook! Bonus this thing is SOLID. It’s built like a tank and I expect it to last a long time. Functionally it heats beautifully. Wonderful pan. Plus a lifetime warranty and made in the USA?! Just WOW.
customer_reviews.author: WESIII

customer_reviews.title: Wife's favorite
customer_reviews.text: My wife, a great homemaker, loves All-Clad. I bought this one to add to her collection and she loves it better than the rest!
customer_reviews.author: culater

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: Just received a gift of stainless cookware, but the set didn’t come with a one quart sauce pan. The most used size in a small household. Holds a regular size can of vegetables or soups. Glad I was able to find the matching 1 qt size here at a great price
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Longbine

customer_reviews.title: Great pot, uncomfortable handle, rim dings easy
customer_reviews.text: The pot is beautiful, cleans easily, and distributes heat well. The handle is uncomfortable and shaped in a manner that makes tilting and pouring difficult. The handle is also unnecessarily long. Beware, that the sharp edges on the rim of the pot ding very easily if you tap steel utensils against the rim. Overall unhappy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mower

customer_reviews.title: All-Clad will be the best pot and the last pot you'll ever buy.
customer_reviews.text: All-Clad is the best pot you'll ever buy and it'll probably be the last pot you ever buy because they're so well made. They're built really well right here in the USA and they're really sturdy and easy to clean. They don't burn your food and although it is not a non-stick pot they're just as easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Eric in Portland

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Replaced 20 year old cookware with only copper disk on bottom. The difference is amazing never realized how much it would be with the d3 and d5 line! A joy to cook with! I cook everyday so its well worth investing in these pans!
customer_reviews.author: ann picky

customer_reviews.title: Still the best pans out there.
customer_reviews.text: All-Clad stainless is wonderful cookware, though heavy for some cooks. With low heat you get even cooking and believe it or not, become a better cook. Then throw them in the dishwasher for added benefit. Been using All-Clad for 30 years. Gradually switching from the old style anodized LTD All-CLad line to all stainless - primarily for the dishwasher benefit.
customer_reviews.author: Fussy Guy Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but bad handle design
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. I’ve only used it twice so far but it has worked great both times. The only complaint that I have is about the handle. It’s not comfortable to hold and hurts my hand when I lift the pot, it’s also a bit longer than the average pot handle and looks a little strange in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: MandaLee

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size to heat soup
customer_reviews.text: On my countertop induction cooktop, I can heat a can of soup faster than in a microwave and without having to clean up the inside of the microwave after the splatter. I run the sauce pan under the faucet and it's ready to be put away.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Reed

customer_reviews.title: Super Nice Quality Cookware
customer_reviews.text: I doubt that I could write any thoughts about All-Clad cookware that is not already known or shared by anyone who has had the pleasure of using this fine cookware. It is both beautiful and functional and heats up quickly and evenly on my commercial grade range. It arrived promptly and well-packed for shipping from this Amazon seller. It washes up very nicely and I've only had to lightly clean it with barkeeper's friend one time. Displays very nicely on my pot rack and cleverly stores the lid on the long handle. I will be purchasing more in this line and would not hesitate to buy as a gift or recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Socalartgal

customer_reviews.title: Burnt marks on the bottom of pan
customer_reviews.text: It’s a well used pan- sold for $110. Had burnt marks at the bottom and inside. Wrong listing clearly. Amazon took back a return and sold it unchecked.
customer_reviews.author: Freedom

customer_reviews.title: but can spend more if you like. But as a daily cooker
customer_reviews.text: What can I say; expensive as all heck, and worth every penny....... you don't need D5 or copper core, but can spend more if you like. But as a daily cooker, this is the standard.......
customer_reviews.author: LLM

customer_reviews.title: The best there is.
customer_reviews.text: I’m an All Clad user and I have a variety of All Clad pots and pans, I needed a sauce pan not too big and I got this to make sauces and gravies, the heat distribution is just great and it holds the heat much longer than aluminum does, I’ve never had any scorching issues as heat control is a big factor as well,.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M. Babila

customer_reviews.title: Great reputation, but consider whether it's for you
customer_reviews.text: Its All-Clad so it works great, heat transfer and such, BUT it is heavy, the handle is narrow so it's hard to have good control when the pot is full (I need to use 2 hands) and lid handle gets too hot to use without a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Virgina John

customer_reviews.title: Lasts Forever
customer_reviews.text: The price seems a little high, but these last forever. They go in the dishwasher unlike the kind with a coating. I have used an Allclad sauté pan for 18 years and it looks new.
customer_reviews.author: consumer999

customer_reviews.title: Quality issue
customer_reviews.text: The pot just got delivered today and It had a dark line on the edge, plus it came with a small dark spot which feels like a tiny dent. Afraid that this is those salt pits and will only get worse after more uses.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Yung

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a while now and couldn't be happier. The weight of the pan tells it all. With the three layer pancake of metals it creates a smooth even heat inside the pot. No hot spots. It cleans up easy since we never use metal utensils. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sackinger

customer_reviews.title: Quality made in the USA!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 3 stainless pots this past month and this is a keeper. Previous pots purchased from other sellers at lower cost and flawed materials after a few uses. You pay for quality and of coarse, it’s made in the real USA!
customer_reviews.author: Diane S.

customer_reviews.title: Zero star!!!
customer_reviews.text: The pot is okay, but lid is used!!! There are multiple deep scratches on it! I didn’t pay for used item! Shame on you! Better to buy from official web site.
customer_reviews.author: Irina

customer_reviews.title: depth of pot
customer_reviews.text: Wanted small pot to cook4 eggs, however it is not deep enough and when you add water to cover eggs, it boils over. It would be fine for 2 eggs, but not four
customer_reviews.author: carol c.

customer_reviews.title: The best pot.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely top pot. It has great heat distribution. I take extra care and try to clean it right after use. Have not burnEd anything in it so I am not sure how easy to clean that will be. We use anything from pasta to sauces
customer_reviews.author: Elizabet Iontcheva

customer_reviews.title: Cooks like a dream, lasts forever, works with magnetic stove tops
customer_reviews.text: The best! Cleans up great, heats evenly and will be handed down to my grandchildren. Great for browning something on the stove top then putting the pan and ingredients in the oven. Tip: to keep the inside bottom shiny after cooking pasta or something that leaves a film, use the stove top glass cleaner. Works like charm.
customer_reviews.author: Mockingbird

customer_reviews.title: All-Clad, All Everything
customer_reviews.text: The 3 qt pot is a perfect size for so many of my needs...it is weighty, not heavy. The size of the handle is perfect for me as I pour to empty. I would still suggest holding it and feeling it. It is the "real deal."
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P.

customer_reviews.title: I love All-Clad. I have a ceramic cook top and ...
customer_reviews.text: I love All-Clad. I have a ceramic cook top and it heats evenly and quickly on. Cleaning is a breeze. The pot is heavier than my old pans so when full it requires a lot of strength to remove it off the stove but definitely worth it. I would LOVE to have an entire set. I currently also have a wok that I love very much too.
customer_reviews.author: DMSunshine

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love. It's an all-clad pot
customer_reviews.text: What's not to love. It's an all-clad pot. That about says it all, no? If not, all-clad is used by most of the cooking shows for a reason. It may be a little pricey. However, you get what you pay for. Buy cheap and you'll be buying again, real soon.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Smoking pot
customer_reviews.text: Well, I don’t use it to smoke foods. But this pot is smoking. Love it. Small, durable, you get what you pay for people. Oh, you want to use it in the oven? Cool. It’s safe. Have fun.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: How ccan you not love it?
customer_reviews.text: If you are devoted to All-Clad you find a way to justify the expense.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Jean

customer_reviews.title: are perfect. If you want to buy one sauce pan ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a gorgeous sauce pan. The lines, the finish, the heft, are perfect. If you want to buy one sauce pan that performs, looks great, and doesn't break the bank, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: ra33it

customer_reviews.title: top notch for the pot but...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful piece. Heats up good. The handle is not hot which my wife loves. But you figure All-Clad would have found a way to have material on the handle of the lid to be cooler. It is too hot to handle without a cloth or mitt.
customer_reviews.author: Kingfish

customer_reviews.title: Good pot, but hot lid
customer_reviews.text: I love All Clad pans, but I’m giving this one only four stars because the lid becomes so hot when cooking rice, etc., that you can’t lift it off without an oven mitt. A bit of a pain.

customer_reviews.title: Price does indicate quality
customer_reviews.text: As with all of the other All-Clad products, this one is also of the highest caliber quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Bush

customer_reviews.title: I like the 1.5 qt. size for smaller, one or two person, servings
customer_reviews.text: I really love this 1.5 qt. size. It's perfect to heat up a can of soup for one or two persons. I use it almost daily. It looks good and it's got the All-Clad quality.
customer_reviews.author: D. Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my lunch everyday. Everyone should have a 1 quart saucepan.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hawthorne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality heavy weight cookware.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean, heats good on induction, durable and reliable. Prices are right. No cons, except occassionly will have to clean "inside", not outside, pot with barkeeprs. That goes for any pot though.

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I love all-clad. I wish I could afford more..piece by piece as I replace them. Washes l Well, get heat distribution and goes easier in the oven I like the weight as well. Not heavy
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be really well made, but is ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be really well made, but is a bit heavy. We had a different brand that did not hold up well over the years. Purchased in part because of the long handles. We find that the short loop handles (directly over the burner) expose hands to far too much heat.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Best pans ever
customer_reviews.text: All-Clad pans are wonderful and worth the high price if you can afford it.
customer_reviews.author: Devoted Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: Thoroughly satisfied with the build quality and usability. Although a bit pricy, if you are looking for a quality, small sauce pan that is an excellent heat conductor--I use it on an IH stovetop--you cannot go wrong with purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon V.

customer_reviews.title: Great for sauces!
customer_reviews.text: Great heat distribution but you need to use Bar Keeper’s Friend to keep it looking nice and shiny.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: These don't stack, and I need them to as we have a small kitchen. Lid gets too hot.
customer_reviews.author: ellenkary

customer_reviews.title: great saucepan
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, very well made, lide fits tight. My only complaint is the handle, my hands are big and I wish the handle was just a little bit bigger, minor complaint, other than that I love it and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: bigbeardriver

customer_reviews.title: All Clad pans are the best.
customer_reviews.text: I love All-Clad pans. Before I had cooked in them I didnt imagine that the price difference was worth it...and then I got one. The best pans. No scorching, easy clean up, and a heavy duty lifetime pan. The price on this is pretty good as well!

customer_reviews.title: Great small saucepan!
customer_reviews.text: Great saucepan! Cooks things really nice, cleans up great! Nice size for sauces, gravy, etc.

customer_reviews.title: All-Clad Stainless Steel 3-Ply Bonded Pans
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in good condition and on time. The quality of this product is exceptionally good. Conduction of heat is perfect. It works exactly as it's name deserved. I recommend it to every serious cooks.

The stainless steel finish is easy to clean. I want more!! A great purchase.

customer_reviews.text: I needed a slightly smaller pot. This was perfect. Love it for a small amount of rice or soup.

customer_reviews.title: Ugh!
customer_reviews.text: I too am one of the very few disappointed with this pan. It’s discolored every time I use it. At every temperature and all types of food. Also, because of the deepness of the 2 qt pan, the heat distribution is off.

customer_reviews.title: A staple for any well equipped kitchen, best made saucepan I've owned

product_meta.title: All-Clad 4201.5 Stainless Steel Tri-Ply Bonded Dishwasher Safe Sauce Pan with Lid Cookware, 1.5-Quart, Silver
product_meta.description: Size:1.5-QuartBecause of its shape, this All-Clad Stainless 4201.5 1.5-Quart sauce pan pan is ideal for making sauces, heating liquids, cooking food in liquids and reheating. With high, straight sides and a smaller surface area, the sauce pan holds heat well and limits evaporation. The classic sauce pan is a versatile essential found in a variety of sizes in every well- equipped kitchen, and it can be used with or without its lid to control evaporation. All-Clad’s Stainless 3-ply cookware features a thick-gauge aluminum core that attracts heat fast, while the addition of stainless steel ensures even heat distribution for consistent results across the entire cooking surface, all the way to the rim. Even more, its stainless-steel interior with a starburst finish offers natural stick resistance, letting you know when food is ready to release, and it won’t react with ingredients, so there’s no risk of food picking up a metallic taste. Made in the USA, this stainless-steel cookware offers warp-resistant strength and dishwasher-safe convenience, plus it can be used on any cooktop, including induction. Discover what it means to cook with All-Clad’s most popular cookware collection–All-Clad Stainless is a classic choice for anyone who loves to cook.
feature_bullets: 1.5-Quart sauce pan with high, straight sides – perfect for making sauces or heating liquids. Suitable heat source is gas, electric, ceramic and halogen. Inside coating is polished
3-ply bonded construction consists of durable stainless steel encapsulating an aluminum core for even heating throughout
Highly polished cooking surface with starburst finish offers stick resistance and easy maintenance, plus won’t react with food
Contoured stainless-steel handles permanently secured with stainless-steel rivets; capacity etched on base; flat stainless-steel lid
Oven- and broiler-safe up to 600 degrees F (without lid); induction compatible; limited lifetime warranty; Made in USA
